basics.name: Jianna Leonora Orias
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: A Computer Engineering senior at the University of Hawaii College of Engineering, expected to graduate in Fall 2020.

highlights: Reviewed the development of Oahu Traffic Control Plans for discrepancies in traffic signals and intelligent transportation systems
Compiled and analyzed traffic data traffic data from various travel time devices
Collected and documented weekly Freeway Service Patrol (FSP) surveys and postage

work.summary: Assists in the design, creation, and advertisement for KCC STEM events and announcements.
highlights: Created the Ho'omanalowai STEM Grant Website
Created the event website for the KCC STEM Undergraduate Resource Fair
Designed the STEM Undergraduate Resource Fair Program
Managed and edited content on all Caesars Entertainment property websites via Adobe Experience Manager
Performed quality assurance (QA) tests to guarantee website functionality and optimal user experience for new content
Collaborated with the UX Design, Web Development, and Production Teams to brainstorm new website content
Led and organized a New Employee Introduction presentation for all of the new Digital Marketing employees

work.summary: Assisted the Caesars Analytics/Optimization team in deploying quality assurance (QA) testing on all Caesars property websites.
highlights: First hired intern for the Analaytics/Optimization professional team
Maintained all of the Caesars Entertainment hotel property websites via Adobe Target
Performed quality assurance (QA) tests to ensure optimal user experience and increase conversion rates to websites

work.company: University of Hawaii, College of Education
work.summary: Assisted the UH Manoa SPED Department in various office tasks requested by the professors and office managers.

volunteer.organization: Engineers' Council at the University of Hawaii (ECUH)
highlights: Leads the College of Engineering student council (ECUH)
Organizes meetings within the College of Engineering faculty and student body
Plans, budgets, and implements various ECUH-sponsored events
Managed 50+ students as Volunteer Coordinator for the Fall 2019 VEX Robotics Tournament

volunteer.organization: Engineers' Council at the University of Hawaii
highlights: Responsible for managing the mass emailing system for ECUH
Assisted in organizing various ECUH-sponsored events
Managed almost 80+ students as Volunteer Coordinator for the Fall 2018 ECUH VEX Robotics Tournament and the Spring 2019 HECO VEX VRC Robotics Championship
ECUH/Hawaii representative at the 2019 National Association of Engineering Student Council (NAESC) Engineering Leadership Summit
